answers.text:
Hello Peter,
A great many cities and counties have policies that they adopt related to citizen engagement, and some of them have uploaded these policies to the Documents section of the Knowledge Network.  You can easily find many of these using the search feature in that section.  You can also check under the Citizen Engagement Topic for related documents, articles, questions, and groups.
Here are some sample documents I found:
A case study of an engagement initiative in Brooklyn Park, MN:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/304087/Case_Study_Community_Engagement_Initiative_in_Brooklyn_Park_MN
A transparent government initiative from Westlake, TX:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/304287/Westlake_Windows__Transparent_Government
This was an award-winning program from Hampton, VA.  The City Manager was able to effectively establish a conversation on budgetary priorities with her city with only a few hundred dollars:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/304295/I_VALUE_Campaign__Reaching_out_to_Residents_to_Balance_the_Budget
I hope this helps you in your search.
Gabe Brehm
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA
